abstract.para: Use the crm corosync status command to check the cluster's quorum status and the status of &qdevice; and &qnet;. You can run this command from any node in the cluster.

topic.para: The following examples show a cluster with two nodes (&node1; and &node2;) and a &qnet; server (&node3;).

example.title: Showing the cluster's quorum status
example.screen:
&prompt.user;sudo crm corosync status quorum 1 &node1; member 2 &node2; member
Quorum information ------------------ Date: [...] Quorum provider: corosync_votequorum Nodes: 2 Node ID: 2 Ring ID: 1.e Quorate: Yes
Votequorum information ---------------------- Expected votes: 3 Highest expected: 3 Total votes: 3 Quorum: 2 Flags: Quorate Qdevice
Membership information ---------------------- Nodeid Votes Qdevice Name 1 1 A,V,NMW &node1; 2 1 A,V,NMW &node2; (local) 0 1 Qdevice

topic.para: The Membership information section shows the following status codes:

listitem.para: Shows the connectivity status between &qdevice; and &corosync;.
Shows if the node has a vote. V means that both nodes can communicate with each other. In a split-brain scenario, one node would be set to V and the other node would be set to NV.

varlistentry.term: MW (master wins) or NMW (not master wins)

listitem.para: Shows if the master_wins flag is set. By default, the flag is not set, so the status is NMW.
Shows that the cluster is not using a quorum device.

example.title: Showing the status of &qdevice;
example.screen:
&prompt.user;sudo crm corosync status qdevice 1 &node1; member 2 &node2; member
Qdevice information ------------------- Model: Net Node ID: 1 HB interval: 10000ms Sync HB interval: 30000ms Configured node list: 0 Node ID = 1 1 Node ID = 2 Heuristics: Disabled Ring ID: 1.e Membership node list: 1, 2 Quorate: Yes Quorum node list: 0 Node ID = 2, State = member 1 Node ID = 1, State = member Expected votes: 3 Last poll call: [...]
Qdevice-net information ---------------------- Cluster name: hacluster QNetd host: &node3;:5403 Connect timeout: 8000ms HB interval: 8000ms VQ vote timer interval: 5000ms TLS: Supported Algorithm: Fifty-Fifty split Tie-breaker: Node with lowest node ID KAP Tie-breaker: Enabled Poll timer running: Yes (cast vote) State: Connected TLS active: Yes (client certificate sent) Connected since: [...] Echo reply received: [...]

example.title: Showing the status of &qnet;
example.screen:
&prompt.user;sudo crm corosync status qnetd 1 &node1; member 2 &node2; member
Cluster "hacluster": Algorithm: Fifty-Fifty split (KAP Tie-breaker) Tie-breaker: Node with lowest node ID Node ID 1: Client address: ::ffff:&subnetI;.185:45676 HB interval: 8000ms Configured node list: 1, 2 Ring ID: 1.e Membership node list: 1, 2 Heuristics: Undefined (membership: Undefined, regular: Undefined) TLS active: Yes (client certificate verified) Vote: ACK (ACK) Node ID 2: Client address: ::ffff:&subnetI;.168:55034 HB interval: 8000ms Configured node list: 1, 2 Ring ID: 1.e Membership node list: 1, 2 Heuristics: Undefined (membership: Undefined, regular: Undefined) TLS active: Yes (client certificate verified) Vote: No change (ACK)
